gurmukhi: iPr kY sMg aUDv ky biRj Bwmn sXwm khY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] qXwg gey n leI suiD hY rs so hmro mnUAw qum jwrXo ]
transliteration: Phir Kai San Oodhav Ke Brij Bhaamanndsyaam Kahai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| Tyaag Gad Na Laisudh(i) Hai Ras So Hamro Manooaa Toum Jdaryo||
translation: The women of Braja said to Udhava again, “On one side he has left us and on the other side, your talk is inflaming our mind;”

gurmukhi: ieau kih kY pun AYsy khXo iqh kO su ikDO kib XO jsu swrXo ] aUDv sXwm so Xo khIXo hir jU quih pRym ibdw kir fwrXo ]904]
transliteration: Io Kah(i) Kai Poun Aise Kahyo Tih Kau Su Kidhau Kabi Yooun Jas(u) Sdaryo|| Oodhav Syaam So Yo Kaheeyo Har(i) Joo Tuh(i) Prem Bidaa Kar(i) Dhdaryo||904||
translation: Saying thus, the gopis added, “O Udhava ! you may tell Krishna this much definitely : ‘O Krishna ! you have bidden farewell to the passion of love.”904.

gurmukhi: Pyir khXo iem aUDv so jb hI sB hI hir ky rs BInI ] jo iqn so khXo aUDv ieau iqn aUDv so ibnqI ieh kInI ]
transliteration: Pher(i) Kahyo Im Oodhav So Jab Hisabh Hihar(i) Ke Ras Bheenee|| Jo Tin So Kahyo Oodhav To Tin Oodhav So Bintieh Keenee||
translation: Getting mad again in the passionate love of Krishna, the gopis said to Udhava, “O Udhava ! we request you that;

gurmukhi: kMcn so ijn ko qn Qo joaU hwn ibKY quhI gÍwr nvInI ] aUDv jU hm ko qij kY qumry ibn sXwm kCU suD lInI ]905]
transliteration: Kanchanndso Jin Ko Tan Tho Jooo Haan Bikhai Tuhigvaar Naveenee|| Oodhav Joo Ham Ko Taj(i) Kai Toumre Bin Syaam Kachhodh Sudh Leenee||905||
translation: “Those gopis, whose bodies were like gold, their bodies have been destroyed; O Udhava ! none except you has communicated with us.”905.

gurmukhi: eyk khY Aiq Awquru hÍY iek kop khY ijn qy ihq BwgXo ] aUDv jU ijh dyKn ko hmro mnUAw Aiq hI AnurwgXo ]
transliteration: Ek Kahai At(i) Aatur(u) Hvai Ik Kop Kahai Jin Te Hit Bhaagyo|| Oodhav Joo Jih Dekhan Ko Hamro Manooaa At(i) Hianuraagyo||
translation: Someone in extreme worry and someone in extreme ire is saying, “O Udhava! he, for whose sight, our love is overflowing, the same Krishna has cast off his love for us;

gurmukhi: so hmko qij gXo pur mY pur bwsn ky rs BIqr pwgXo ] jau hir jU biRj nwir qjI biRj nwrn BI biRj nwQ qXwgXo ]906]
transliteration: So Hamko Taj(i) Gyo Pur Mai Pur Baasan Ke Ras Bheetar Paagyol Jau Har(i) Brij Daar(i) Tajibrij Naaran Bhibrij Naath Tyaagyo||906||
translation: “He has forsaken us and has absorbed himself with the residents of his city; it is true the way in which Krishna has abandoned the women of Braja, now you may accept this that the women of Braja have abandoned Krishna.”906.

gurmukhi: eykn XoN khXo sXwm qjXo iek AYsy khY hm kwm krYgI ] ByK ijqy khXo jogn ky iqqny hm Awpny AMg frYgI ]
transliteration: Ekan Yon Kahyo Syaam Tajyo Ik Aise Kahai Ham Kaam Daraigee|| Bhekh Jite Kahyo Jogad Ke Titne Ham Aapane An Daraigee||
translation: Some of the gopis said that they had forsaken Krishna and some of them said that they would do whatever Krishna has asked them to do; the guises that Krishna had asked them to do; the guises that Krishna had asked the gopis to wear, they would wear them;

gurmukhi: eyk khY hm jYh qhwN iek AYsy khY guin hI aucrYgI ] eyk khY hm KY mir hY ibK iek XoN khY DXwn hI bIc mrYgI ]907]
transliteration: Ek Kahai Ham Jaih Tahaan Ik Aise Kahai Goun(i) Hioucdaraigee|| Eh Kahai Ham Khai Ham Khai Mar(i) Hai Bikh Ik Yon Kahai Dhyaan Hibeech Daraigee||907||
translation: Some of them said that they would go to Krishna and others said that they would sing his praises; some gopi says that she will die by taking poison and someone else says that she will die while meditating upon him.907.
Speech of Udhava addressed to the gopis:

gurmukhi: ipiK gÍwrin kI ieh BwNq dSw ibsmY huie aUDv XoN aucro ] hm jwnq hY qumrI hir so bil pRIq GnI ieh kwm kro ]
transliteration: Pikh(i) Gvaaran(i) Kieh Bhaant Dashaa Bismai Hue Oodhav Yon Ouchro|| Ham Jaanat Hai Toumrihar(i) So Bal(i) Preet Ghanieh Kaamdaro||
translation: Seeing such a state of gopis, Udhava marveled over it and said, “I know that you are immensely in love with Krishna,

gurmukhi: joaU sXwm pTXo qum pY hm ko ieh rwvl ByK n AMg Dro ] qij kY giH ko pun kwj sBY sKI mory hI DXwn kY bIc Aro ]908]
transliteration: Jaoo Syaam Pathyo Toum Pai Ham Ko Eh Raaval Bhekh Na An Daro|| Taj(i) Kai Grih Ko Poun Kaaj Sabhai Sakhimore Hidhyaan Kai Beecdaro||908||
translation: “But you are advised not to assume the garb of Yogins; I have been sent by Krishna to you ask you to forsake your homely duties and only meditate on Krishna.”908.
